Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge correctly applied the residency requirement under section 5(1) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant, Li Zhang, claimed residence from October 2, 2002; accumulated only 922 days of physical presence in Canada within the four years preceding the application
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship application denied due to insufficient residency days
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Citizenship Judge's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge applied the statutory residency requirement strictly based on physical presence
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged incorrect application of the residency requirement
Assessment_Factor: Accumulation of 1095 days of residence within four years prior to application
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review process following administrative decision
Evidence_Used: Records of entry and exit, applicant’s testimony or documentation regarding residence dates
Application_Basis: Requirement of at least 1095 days of physical presence in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Documentation supporting claimed days of residence
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the Citizenship Judge’s decision and approval of citizenship application
Governing_Rule: An applicant must have physically resided in Canada for at least 1095 days within the four years immediately before applying
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Only 922 days of verified residence, falling short of the 1095-day threshold
Harm_Assessment: No harm found; decision deemed reasonable
Cause_Description: Li Zhang's citizenship application was denied due to insufficient residency days
Evidence_Handling: Residency days were calculated based on documented physical presence
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient evidence to establish 1095 days of physical residence
Evidence_Assessment: The judge assessed the applicant’s evidence and found it insufficient to meet the statutory threshold
Decision_Rationale: The qualitative test does not apply when the quantitative physical presence requirement is not satisfied
Decision_Making_Body: Federal Court (on judicial review), upholding the Citizenship Judge's decision
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of sufficient documentation or proof to establish required residency duration
